subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Book for sale on how to mo dify the 12-469, why?

OMG

How he is still around and taken at all seriously in this field is be=
yond me.

 

I made the mistake of pag $100.00 to go to one of his conferen=
ces back in the late 90's and felt so robbed that I think I crashed the nex=
t two or three in an attempt to get some kind of value for the money he got=
 from me, but the conferences were so bad i couldn't even sit through them.=


He went  on the Maury show a while back with a bunch of EVPs that weren't=
 even his..

 

He would sell his mother if he thought he could get a price=
 for her...

 

Aside from that, this is a problem in the paranormal commun=
ity, where people charge for various training and certifications that are  =
worthless..

and other people charge hundreds of dollars for Frank's Box se=
ssions.

It is important that we educate people (the public) about free inf=
ormation so they don't get taken, BUT I still feel that any of these boxes,=
 in the hands of the wrong person, can be extremely dangerous.  When I hear=
 the negative EVPs on youtube I cringe.. In 15 years I have only gotten two=
 negative EVPs and I understand why I got them..

 

 



-----Original Mes=
sage-----
From: "ourobouros2k2" <ourobouros2k2@...>
Sent: Friday, Nov=
ember 21, 2008 8:32am
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Bo=
ok for sale on how to modify the 12-469, why?

Ole' "Dr" Dave, lol hadn't h=
eard from him in a long while. He does
have longevity in the field, but his=
 tendency to boast about his
supposed accolades and merits regarding the au=
thenticity of his orb
photos, coupled with his self-glorifying tendency to =
proclaim himself
the king of all paranormal investigation has pretty much r=
elegated him
to eventual obscurity. Back in the early days (1999 I think) I=

submitted my flegling group's website to IGHS associate member
program, ye=
t Mr. Oester declined saying that my website containing a
black background =
was too hard on his eyes and no one would take my
site seriously for the sa=
me reason. 

Enter the popularity of TAPS and the highly visible "war of bl=
ogs"
that followed regarding their credibility in his eyes and folks were
w=
itness to Oester's online self-destruction. He still pops up from
time to t=
ime and despite my efforts still sends me his newsletter
telling me where a=
nd when IGHS RV is going to be et cetera. I hate to
see that he is charging=
 for the information regarding the freely
available shack hack, no doubt an=
 attempt on his part to reinvent
himself and seek legitimacy in the field. =
This doesn't surprise me,
however, seeing as how in the past he would charg=
e for special
membership to areas of his website where he showcased FREELY =
submitted
photos and evp from folks across the country. 

Andy

--- In EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)"
wrote:
>
> It was brought to my =
attention that a guy named Dave Oester is selling 
> an ebook on how to mod=
ify the Radio Shack 12-469, something he calls 
> the 'Digcom'. (Isn't it j=
ust the Radio Shack Hack?)
> Has anyone purchased this book? Has anyone had=
 dealings with this Dave 
> Oester? I guess he produces other types of eboo=
ks too.
> 
> There is so much FREE information out there on how to modify t=
he 12-
> 469, I wonder if his book is actually selling...
> 
> Thanks,
> - =
Mike C. (UFO Geek)
